headline: Is Gartner (IT) Using Its Expanded Buyback Plan to Redefine Its Core Investment Story?
summary: Gartner, Inc. recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing higher sales of US$286.2 million and revenue of US$1.75 billion, alongside lower net income of US$242.1 million, while also completing a long-running share repurchase program and expanding its buyback authorization to US$7.50 billion. At the same time, Gartner agreed to sell its Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp businesses to G2 and added AI expert Daniela Rus and veteran investment executive Edward Bousa to its now...

headline: Fiserv Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Decline 7% Y/Y
summary: FISV fourth-quarter 2025 EPS beat estimates, but revenues fall 7% y/y as merchant and financial solutions show mixed results, and the 2026 guidance stays modest.

headline: Centric Software Named in Gartner Competitive Landscape Report for Retail Unified Price, Promotion and Markdown Optimization Solutions
summary: Centric Software® is pleased to announce that it has been named in Gartner's Competitive Landscape: Retail Unified Price, Promotion and Markdown Optimization Solutions, a report that examines vendors supporting retailers with AI-powered pricing, promotion and markdown optimized capabilities. Centric Software delivers innovative, integrated, end-to-end AI-powered enterprise solutions to take products from concept to commercialization. headline: Tosi Recognized in the 2026 Gartner® Market Guide for CPS Secure Remote Access
summary: Tosi, the global pioneer in OT connectivity, today announced that it has been acknowledged as a Representative Vendor in the 2026 Gartner® Market Guide for CPS Secure Remote Access [1], published in February 2026. In this report, Gartner defines the CPS (Cyber Physical Systems) secure remote access products market as "products that enable employees, contractors, or original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) to safely and securely operate, maintain, or update CPS remotely." headline: Moderne Introduces Prethink to Give AI Agents the Structured Knowledge They’ve Been Missing
summary: MIAMI, February 10, 2026--Moderne, the enterprise code management platform for evolving large, multi-repository codebases, today announced the launch of Moderne Prethink, a new capability designed to give AI agents the structured software knowledge they need to operate reliably inside large, complex, and interconnected real-world codebases.

headline: Genesys Unveils Industry’s First Agentic Virtual Agent Powered by LAMs for Enterprise CX ​
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 10, 2026--Genesys®, a global cloud leader in AI-Powered Experience Orchestration, today announced the industry’s first agentic virtual agent built with large action models (LAMs) for enterprise CX, enabling autonomous, end-to-end resolution of customer requests. The new Genesys Cloud™ Agentic Virtual Agent understands customer goals, determines the next steps and executes complex actions across front and back-office systems and teams. headline: A Look At Gartner (IT) Valuation After Q4 Earnings And Expanded Share Buybacks
summary: Why Gartner’s latest earnings and buybacks matter now Gartner (IT) just paired fourth quarter earnings with fresh capital return moves, reporting higher revenue than a year ago, lower net income, and an expanded share repurchase program that continues to reshape its equity base. See our latest analysis for Gartner. Those earnings and buyback updates come against a sharp reset in sentiment, with a 7 day share price return of a 21.07% decline and a 30 day share price return of a 35.59% decline...

headline: Airrived Named Gartner Tech Innovator in Agentic AI, Defining the Agentic Era for Enterprise Security and IT
summary: DUBLIN, Calif., February 10, 2026--Airrived, the company behind the Agentic OS, today announced it has been named a Tech Innovator in Agentic AI in the Gartner "Emerging Tech: Tech Innovators in Agentic AI" report (16 September 2025). Airrived was recognized for its composable multiagent architecture and expert cybersecurity agents that enable automated risk remediation, positioning it as a leader in domain-specialized agentic AI for enterprise security, IT, and business operations.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Gartner’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Gartner’s fourth quarter results were marked by a negative market reaction, despite meeting Wall Street’s revenue expectations and posting better-than-expected non-GAAP profit. Management cited a more challenging selling environment, shaped by external pressures such as government spending constraints, evolving trade policies, and budget uncertainty among tech clients not focused on artificial intelligence. CEO Eugene Hall acknowledged, “The value bar is higher, but it's also a huge opportunity
